intro: Muehlenbeckia polygonoides, commonly known as the silverleaf muhly, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically forms dense mats of silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, giving them a silvery appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy environments.
